subject: Nutrition
title: How Muscles Use Energy
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: How Muscles Use Energy.

hook.text: Your muscles burn different fuels depending on intensity. Sprinting and jogging use completely different systems.

buildup.text: At rest, muscles burn mostly fat. During intense exercise, they switch to glycogen stored in muscle tissue.

discovery.text: Your body stores about 2,000 calories of glycogen‚Äîenough for roughly 90 minutes of hard exercise.

twist.text: When glycogen runs out, performance crashes. Runners call this 'hitting the wall' around mile 20.

climax.text: Understanding which fuel system powers your sport is the foundation of all sports nutrition strategy.

punchline.text: Your muscles choose the fuel. Your diet determines the supply.

quiz.question: How many calories of glycogen does the body store?
